top.title: Iran ready to discuss compromises to reach nuclear deal, minister tells BBC in Tehran
top.summary: Majid Takht-Ravanchi, Iran's deputy foreign minister, tells the BBC's Lyse Doucet that the ball was "in America's court to prove that they want to do a deal".

top.title: Eleven killed in Israeli strikes on Gaza, rescuers say
top.summary: The Palestinian Red Crescent say a strike on a tent encampment in northern Gaza killed at least six people.

top.title: Russia killed opposition leader Alexei Navalny using dart frog toxin, UK says
top.summary: There is no innocent explanation for the toxin being found in samples taken from Navalny's body, Foreign Office says.

top.title: Stroke survivors trial new at-home tech: 'It's given me my freedom back'
top.summary: Participants in the NHS 'Triceps' trial wear a device in their ear which emits electrical pulses while they do rehab.

top.title: John Wick game starring Keanu Reeves unveiled at PlayStation showcase
top.summary: It's not the first time the iconic hitman has appeared in games, but Saber's will be the first voiced by Reeves.

top.title: Amazon's Ring ends deal with surveillance firm after backlash
top.summary: A Super Bowl advert had sparked new scrutiny of the smart doorbell company's privacy practices.

title.#text: Why are Epstein’s emails full of equals signs?
AI can’t make good video game worlds yet, and it might never be able to
Jikipedia turns Epstein’s emails into an encyclopedia of his powerful friends
